text.p: The following are the main stories from Friday's Albanian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Nexhmije Hoxha, the widow of Albanian dictator Enver Hoxha, sentenced to 11 years in 1991 for embezzlement, would be freed from jail today.
- The paper's editorial says the ruling Democratic Party is preparing to give Albania's a private television network.
- Albania is on the verge of a "Chinese influenza" epidemic that has come from Macedonia.
- Greece has deported 500 Albanian refugees on Wednesday night and more were expected on Thursday in a Greek police action after 12 thefts in an Athens suburb were blamed on Albanians.
- Leaders of a student union have threatened to boycott lessons until the government meets their demands for better conditions.
- The attempt of the ruling Democratic Party to nip in the bud a students strike by staging talks with its own youth branch has failed.
- Savings Bank of Albania director Bedri Collaku says people should be on guard from sky-high interest rates offered by alleged pyramid schemes and says banks are safer.
- Vefa Holding boss Vehbi Alimuca says the company made $100 million profit from production and it would buy a fleet of 30 planes to start flying to the United States.

- Alimuca said his company, which will be giving five percent a month to investors in its loan-taking operation, is not in the least worried by the problems other firms running similiar schemes were facing.
- The ruling Democratic Party has decided to oust Azem Hajdari, a founding member turned union leader, because his of comments against the policy of the party.
- Albanian health authorities have blocked a Romanian ship with 3,500 tonnes cargo of rice valued at $1.3 million from Taiwan because it gone bad from humidity.
